title: Windows 10, Error Msg "No Disk in Drive:Please insert Disk"
body:
So, I recently upgraded to windows 10, against my better judgement, and apparently I activated some imbedded app called "GamePanel" or also called GameBar, or is it Xbox...heck I don't know.
The error message specifically refers to "GamePanel" but for the life of me I can't find an actual Application called Gamepanel that will allow me to interface with it.

Anyway, the error usually appears when I launch the game and I can cancel or ignore ...for the most part, but occasionally it pops up in the middle of a game and drops me to the desktop where I have to quickly cancel it in order to get back to my game, it's really annoying and I'm wondering if anyone else has encountered this and if so, how was it corrected.

Any assistance in this matter is greatly appreciated.

thanks, ICgamer

replies.body:
I was excited to see the suggestion and immediately tried it before going to work this morning, fired up a custom game, hit Windows +G...and nothing,...
That is one of the issues I tried to articulate earlier...I've never seen an actual interface for gamebar/gamepanel.
I Have no option to make the interface changes you suggested. 
I made sure to put the game in window mode instead of full screen in case these "record" options popped up behind the game, but no such luck.
It's quite strange how I seem to be held hostage by an application that was designed to enhance game play in some fashion yet it is strangely absent.
I've also looked at my "add/remove programs" to see if I could just remove gamebar/gamepanel, but it doesn't seem to be an option there.

Sadly I see no interface for it, no cog, no option to record anything or select "remember this is a game"...sigh.

and I'm not using any fancy gaming keyboard, simple basic keyboard.

Also, if this is of any help, when I go to the Xbox application and look at record device, it actually says I don't have one or there is a problem with it, not that I care, I'm not trying to record anything, so once again

Thank you so so much for the suggestion, I'll keep trying to figure this one out somehow..

ICgamer

Have you tried this:

Open a custom game of League of Legends to prompt the error. While in-game, open up the gamebar by pressing Windows key + G.

Click the cog on the right to open settings, and ensure "Record game in background" is unchecked. Then uncheck "remember this as a game."
Today I learned you can wire a xbox controller to your PC.

I do not have an xbox controller attached
As for the Windows + G...that is an interesting question...
When I first went to Windows 10 I started seeing a message that referred to "Hit W +G" to launch something or another, and I believe it was not only an instruction, but may have also been a "clicky" button itself...well it is VERY likely that I may have clicked it and associated the LoL application with this Gamepanel/GameBar/Xbox application and that is whats causing this error....

However I see no way to dis associate it.

The error is explicitly for GamePanel, I'm looking at it now and it says >>
"GamePanel.exe - No Disk">>>X There is No Disk in the Drive. Please Insert a disk into drive I:.
I have the options to cancel, try again, or continue.

If I cancel I can log into the game...but it eventually pops back up at the most inopportune times. 

Now I see no actual interface for GamePanel, but some research has led me to believe this may be associated with the actual xbox app and related to being able to record game footage, so I've launched the XBOX app and saw it had an inventory of all my games, Including LoL, I removed LoL from it's inventory, and turned off every single option however this still did nothing to stop the error.

Thank you very much for your speedy response, not sure we'll find an answer, but here is hoping for hopes sake.

v/r
ICgamer

I'm not totally familiar with this issue, but I'd like to ask some questions to see if we can get to the bottom of this.  Does this panel appear if you press Windows + G keys?  Do you have a keyboard that might have a game mode function when you press it?   Do you have an Xbox controller wired to your PC, and if so what happens if you unplug it?  

When the game bar appears, you may be able to mouse over it and find a settings option.  There should be an option to disable it there.

I hope that helps!
